definition[0]: to stop someone from taking part in an activity because they have broken a rule
example[0]: They disqualified the team for fielding an underage player.
explanation[0]: Disqualify is often passive in this meaning
definition[1]: to unfairly prevent someone from doing a job or taking part in an activity
example[2]: a system which disqualifies the poor from education
definition[2]: to officially or legally stop someone being allowed to do something, because they have done something wrong
example[3]: The General Medical Council had disqualified a doctor for misconduct.
example[4]: He was disqualified from driving for a drink-driving offence.
